tourBios.intlVics: 2013 Anthem Golf and Country Club [Gateway], 2014 Firekeeper Classic [Adams], 2015 Trilogy Golf Club [Gateway]
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Played PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, making nine starts and recording one top-10, a runner-up in the first event of the season, the 68th Avianca Colombia Open in Bogota. Was tied for the lead after a 68-65 start. Was T3 and two back after a third-round 70. Closed with a 69 to grab second place by five shots, but six back of runaway winner Diego Velásquez. Finished 51st on the Order of Merit… Shot 65-67-64 to finish at 196 (-17) and win an eGolf Gateway Tour's winter series event at Trilogy GC in Gilbert, Arizona in January. Won by two shots to earn $16,000… Finished T79 at the Web.com Tour Q-School in December.

2014: Qualified for PGA TOUR Latinoamérica in January, finishing T23 at the Lima, Peru Q-School… Went on to make 14 starts and nine cuts, three of which resulted in top 10s… Held the 54-hole lead by one at the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic in October, but carded a 73 on the last round to finish T7… Also had a pair of T8s at the TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open in Mexico and the Dominican Republic Open… Ended the Latin American season 35th on the Order of Merit… Won the Firekeeper Classic on the Adams Tour in July, shooting 68-66-70-67 to win by two at 271 (-17).

2013: Finished at 206 (-10) to win an All-American Gateway Tour Winter Series event at Anthem Golf and Country Club in February… Made 5 cuts in 11 starts on the Adams Tour. Collected three top-20s, including a T3 at the Fakier Open in April.

2012: Turned professional in September.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf at the University of Texas (2008-12), where he was member of 2012 NCAA National Championship Team… Best individual finish in college was runner-up at the St. Edwards Invitational as a freshman… While at Plano West High School in Plano, Texas, he took medalist honors at the 2006 Texas State Junior Championship… Won the 2007 AJGA Byron Nelson Championship… Led Plano West H.S. to the team title at the 2008 Texas UIL State Championship… Helped Plano West H.S. to the regional championship in 2008 and district championships in 2007 and 2008… A two-time all-region and all-district selection.
tourBios.personal: Graduated from Plano West Senior High School in Plano, Texas, in 2008…Son of Michael Moon and Carrie Dietze…Has twin brother and sister, who are 10 years younger…Basketball was his "true love growing up, then I woke up."…"Got forever hooked on golf" after beating friend and future Texas teammate Cody Gribble down the stretch at the EDS Byron Nelson Junior Championship in 2007…If not a professional golfer, would be a wine sommelier…First-tee intro song would be "Candy Shop" by 50 Cent…Would like to play any Scottish or Irish golf courses….Favorites include The Score (app), Dez Bryant (non-golfer athlete) and Outliers (book). Favorite places to visit are Austin, Texas, downtown Chicago, Lajitas Resort at Black Jack's Crossing and Pebble Beach. Enjoys watching the Dallas Cowboys and Dallas Mavericks, Texas, Auburn and North Texas. Likes the Red Hot Chili Peppers, George Strait and Anything Texas Country. Favorite movies are "The Other Guys," "Deja Vu" and "Man on Fire," while "True Detective" and "Homeland" are his favored TV shows…Best single sporting event attended was Monday practice round at the Masters…Dream foursome would include George W. Bush, Denzel Washington and Wyatt Earp…Bucket list includes a happy, healthy family and a green jacket…Favorite quote is from Michael Jordan, who said, "I've failed over and over and over again. That's why I succeed."…"Feels fortunate to play this crazy game every day."…Twitter and Instagram name is @alexmoongolf

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T79 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Played Latinoamérica, making nine starts and recording one top-10, a runner-up in the first event of the season, the 68 Avianca Colombia Open in Bogota. Was tied for the lead after a 68-65 start. Was T3 and two back after a third-round 70. Closed with a 69 to grab second place by five shots, but six back of runaway winner Diego Velasquez. Finished 51st on the Order of Merit.	

2014: Qualified for Latinoamérica in January, finishing T23. Went on to make 14 starts and nine cuts, three of which resulted in top 10s. The top 10s (a pair of T8s) came at the TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open in Mexico and the Dominican Republic Open. Ended the season 35th on the Order of Merit.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: In high school, was the 5A State District and Regional medalist in 2008 and played on that year's 5A state championship winning team...In junior golf, took medalist honors at the 2006 Texas State Junior Championship and won the 2007 AJGA EDS Byron Nelson Junior Championship...At the University of Texas, was an academic honor roll selection in 2009 and 2010. In 2012, played on the Longhorns NCAA national championship winning team as a senior.

Favorite places to visit are Austin, Texas, downtown Chicago, Lajitas Resort at Black Jack's Crossing and Pebble Beach. Enjoys watching the Dallas Cowboys and Dallas Mavericks, Texas, Auburn and North Texas. Likes the Red Hot Chili Peppers, George Strait and Anything Texas Country. Favorite movies are "The Other Guys," "Deja Vu" and "Man on Fire," while "True Detective" and "Homeland" are his favored TV shows...Best single sporting event attended was Monday practice round at the Masters...Dream foursome would include George W. Bush, Denzel Washington and Wyatt Earp...Bucket list includes a happy, healthy family and a green jacket...Favorite quote is from Michael Jordan, who said, "I've failed over and over and over again. That's why I succeed."..."Feels fortunate to play this crazy game every day."...Twitter handle is @alexmoongolf.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was 2nd in 2015 at the 68 Avianca Colombia Open presentado por Arturo Calle.
